choices.E: An operating system OSOPER group be created for users with the SYSOPER system privilege.
choices.A: The OSBACKUPDBA, OSDGDBA, and OSKMDBA OS groups must be created.
choices.B: An operating system OSDBA group must be created for users with the SYSDBA system privilege.
choices.D: The Oracle Database 12c installation must have a separate Oracle inventory directory.
choices.C: The Oracle Database 12c software owner and the Oracle Grid Infrastructure owner must belong to the same Oracle Inventory Group.

choices.C: Existing dump files can be overwritten during an export operation.
choices.A: You cannot specify how partitioned tables should be handled during an import operation.

questions.question_text: Which two statements are true about Oracle Data Pump export and import operations? (Choose two.)

Your database instance has the following parameter setting:
OS_AUTHENT_PREFIX = OPS$
You execute the following command:
//IMG//

And then grant OPS$GUEST_USER the CREATE SESSION privilege.
Which two statements are true? (Choose two.)

choices.A: GUEST_USER can query the tables created in the USERS tablespace by default.
choices.D: GUEST_USER can log on to the database without specifying a username and password.
choices.B: The authentication details for GUEST_USER are stored in the database password file.
choices.C: A local GUEST_USER OS account should exist before GUEST_USER can log on to the database.
choices.E: GUEST_USER is forced to change the password at the first login.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: CD
Answer is CD

https://oracle-base.com/articles/misc/os-authentication

To enable external (OS) authentication of database user.
-Create an os user (ex: timhall) using useradd command on unix:
 useradd timhall
 passwd timhall
-Check value for os_authent_prefix (default is OPS$): This prefix is required for the database to identify that the user is being authenticated by OS
-Add user to database: CREATE USER ops$timhall IDENTIFIED EXTERNALLY; GRANT CREATE SESSION TO ops$timhall;

Selected Answer: ACD
https://oracle-base.com/articles/12c/upgrading-to-12c

Copy the parameter and password files from the old home to the 12c home.

choices.D: copying the password file to the new Oracle home
choices.E: copying net configuration files to the new Oracle home
choices.B: running utlu121s.sql from the new Oracle home to display information about the required initialization parameters
choices.A: running preupgrad.sql in Oracle Database 11g to generate fix-up scripts and a log file
choices.C: copying the initialization parameter file to the new Oracle home

questions.question_text:
You want to upgrade an Oracle Database running Oracle Database 11g to Oracle Database 12c.
Which three tasks should be performed before a manual upgrade? (Choose three.)

choices.D: The predefined resource role includes the unlimited_tablespace privilege.
choices.C: A role can contain both system and object privileges.
choices.E: All roles are owned by the sys user.
choices.A: A role cannot be assigned external authentication.
choices.B: A role can be granted to other roles.
choices.F: The predefined connect role is always automatically granted to all new users at the time of their creation.

discussion.content:
This is new in Oracle 12c. The RESOURCE Role used to grant unlimited tablespace, however it stopped as of Oracle 12.1.0.2

Reference: https://docs.oracle.com/database/121/DBSEG/release_changes.htm#DBSEG000
